intro: Pimpinella tragium subsp. depressa, commonly known as the narrowleaf cowparsley, is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its umbellate inflorescence and aromatic foliage. It is a biennial or perennial herb that typically grows in moist, calcareous soils in grasslands and woodland margins. The plant features finely divided, lanceolate leaves and small white or pale yellow flowers arranged in compound umbels. It is native to Europe and parts of western Asia, and it often thrives in disturbed or open habitats. Due to its delicate appearance and ecological role, it is sometimes considered a characteristic species of certain habitats.
